dcterms:creator: J. Gubernatis
N. Kawashima
P. Werner
dcterms:description: Variational Monte Carlo (VMC) is an algorithm for approximating the ground-state energy and wave function of a quantum many-body system, specifically applied to the antiferromagnetic Heisenberg model for N spin-1/2 particles in a one-dimensional periodic chain.
dcterms:title: Antiferromagnetic Heisenberg Model

dcterms:creator: G. Carleo
M. Troyer
dcterms:description: The neural quantum state ansatz is a neural network-based family of wave functions used in VMC calculations, providing a flexible representation of complex wave functions.
dcterms:title: Neural Quantum State Ansatz

dcterms:creator: D. Luo
B. K. Clark
dcterms:description: The Restricted Boltzmann Machine (RBM) is a type of neural network used to represent quantum many-body wave functions, allowing for efficient evaluation and differentiation.
dcterms:title: Restricted Boltzmann Machine (RBM)

dcterms:creator: F. Becca
S. Sorella
dcterms:description: Variational Monte Carlo (VMC) approaches for correlated systems, providing methods for estimating ground state energies and wave functions.
dcterms:title: Variational Monte Carlo (VMC)

dcterms:creator: D. J. Earl
M. W. Deem
dcterms:description: Parallel tempering is an enhanced sampling method used to improve the sampling of probability distributions in Monte Carlo simulations.
dcterms:title: Parallel Tempering

dcterms:creator: J. KÃ¤stner
dcterms:description: Umbrella sampling is a technique used to enhance sampling in molecular simulations, allowing for better estimates of free energy landscapes.
dcterms:title: Umbrella Sampling

dcterms:creator: E. H. Thiede
B. Van Koten
J. Weare
A. R. Dinner
dcterms:description: The eigenvector method for umbrella sampling enables error analysis and improves the efficiency of sampling in molecular simulations.
dcterms:title: Eigenvector Method for Umbrella Sampling

dcterms:creator: H. Bethe
dcterms:description: The Bethe Ansatz provides an exact solution for certain models in statistical mechanics, particularly in one-dimensional systems.
dcterms:title: Bethe Ansatz
